result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie John Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Any conditions as determined by agent.  Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Seek and maintain part time employment. Enroll in a GED programming, and work towards receiving GED diploma.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Consecutive. To be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 5 days for the first violation, 10 days for the second violation, and 15 days for the third violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnie John Armstrong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:    09-18-2014              Initials:  AAC

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 4 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 30 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 5 days for the first violation, 10 days for the second violation, and 15 days for the third violation.
- Any conditions as determined by agent.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.
- Seek and maintain part time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Enroll in a GED programming, and work towards receiving GED diploma. 
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
At request of clerk in Branch 3 file is given to defense counsel to bring back to court for 1:30 sentencing today.  Atty Lin is directed to take file to courtroom FORTHWITH.

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 3.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 1:30PM TODAY FOR SENTENCING  in Branch 3.

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel needs more time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/29/14.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Edgar Lin.  Dennis Murphy for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing being set on the 5th business day per District Attorney request to accomadate off-groups.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Ronnie John Armstrong in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
